t: Luke 9
Sending Out the Twelve
Then*p He called His twelve disciples together and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.
He sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
And He said to them, “Take*r nothing*r for*r the*r journey,*r neither*r staffs*r nor*r bag*r nor*r bread*r nor*r money;*r and*r do*r not*r have*r two*r tunics*r apiece.*r
“Whatever*rp house*r you*r enter,*r stay*r there,*r and*r from*r there*r depart.*r
And*r whoever*r will*r not*r receive*r you,*r when*r you*r go*r out*r of*r that*r city,*r shake*r off*r the*r very*r dust*r from*r your*r feet*r as*r a*r testimony*r against*r them.”*r
So*p they departed and went through the towns, preaching the gospel and healing everywhere.
Herod Seeks to See Jesus
Now*p Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by Him; and he was perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead,
and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again.
Herod said, “John I have beheaded, but who is this of whom I hear such things?” So he sought to see Him.
Feeding the Five Thousand
And*p the apostles, when they had returned, told Him all that they had done. Then He took them and went aside privately into a deserted place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.
But when the multitudes knew it,*i they followed Him; and He received them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who had need of healing.

When the day began to wear away, the twelve came and said to Him, “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding towns and country, and lodge and get provisions; for we are in a deserted place here.”
But*p He said to them, “You*r give*r them*r something*r to*r eat.”*r And*p they said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we go and buy food for all these people.”
For there were about five thousand men. Then*p He said to His disciples, “Make*r them*r sit*r down*r in*r groups*r of*r fifty.”*r
And they did so, and made them all sit down.
Then*p He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed and broke them, and gave them*i to the disciples to set before the multitude.
So they all ate and were filled, and twelve baskets of the leftover fragments were taken up by them.
Peter Confesses Jesus as the Christ
And*p it happened, as He was alone praying, that*i His disciples joined Him, and He asked them, saying, “Who*r do*r the*r crowds*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r
So*p they answered and said, “John the Baptist, but some say*i Elijah; and others say*i that one of the old prophets has risen again.”
He*p said to them, “But*r who*r do*r you*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r Peter*p answered and said, “The Christ of God.”
Jesus Predicts His Death and Resurrection
And*p He strictly warned and commanded them to tell this to no one,

saying, “The*r Son*r of*r Man*r must*r suffer*r many*r things,*r and*r be*r rejected*r by*r the*r elders*r and*r chief*r priests*r and*r scribes,*r and*r be*r killed,*r and*r be*r raised*r the*r third*r day.”*r
Take Up the Cross and Follow Him
Then*p He said to them*i all, “If*r anyone*r desires*r to*r come*r after*r Me,*r let*r him*r deny*r himself,*r and*r take*r up*r his*r cross*r daily,*r and*r follow*r Me.*r
For*r whoever*r desires*r to*r save*r his*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r but*r whoever*r loses*r his*r life*r for*r My*r sake*r will*r save*r it.*r
For*r what*r profit*r is*r it*r to*r a*r man*r if*r he*r gains*r the*r whole*r world,*r and*r is*r himself*r destroyed*r or*r lost?*r

For*r whoever*r is*r ashamed*r of*r Me*r and*r My*r words,*r of*r him*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r ashamed*r when*r He*r comes*r in*r His*r own*ir glory,*r and*r in*ir His*ir Father’s,*r and*r of*r the*r holy*r angels.*r
But*r I*r tell*r you*r truly,*r there*r are*r some*r standing*r here*r who*r shall*r not*r taste*r death*r till*r they*r see*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
Jesus Transfigured on the Mount
Now*p it came to pass, about eight days after these sayings, that He took Peter, John, and James and went up on the mountain to pray.
As He prayed, the appearance of His face was altered, and His robe became*i white and*i glistening.
And behold, two men talked with Him, who were Moses and Elijah,
who appeared in glory and spoke of His decease which He was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
But Peter and those with him were heavy with sleep; and when they were fully awake, they saw His glory and the two men who stood with Him.

Then it happened, as they were parting from Him, that*i Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here; and let us make three tabernacles: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah”—not knowing what he said.
While*p he was saying this, a cloud came and overshadowed them; and they were fearful as they entered the cloud.
And a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son. Hear Him!”
When the voice had ceased, Jesus was found alone. But they kept quiet, and told no one in those days any of the things they had seen.
A Boy Is Healed
Now*p it happened on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, that a great multitude met Him.
Suddenly a man from the multitude cried out, saying, “Teacher, I implore You, look on my son, for he is my only child.
And behold, a spirit seizes him, and he suddenly cries out; it convulses him so that he foams at*i the*i mouth;*i and it departs from him with great difficulty, bruising him.
So I implored Your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”
Then*p Jesus answered and said, “O*r faithless*r and*r perverse*r generation,*r how*r long*r shall*r I*r be*r with*r you*r and*r bear*r with*r you?*r Bring*r your*r son*r here.”*r
And as he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him.*i Then Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the child, and gave him back to his father.
Jesus Again Predicts His Death
And*p they were all amazed at the majesty of God. But*p while everyone marveled at all the things which Jesus did, He said to His disciples,
“Let*r these*r words*r sink*r down*r into*r your*r ears,*r for*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r about*r to*r be*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r men.”*r
But they did not understand this saying, and it was hidden from them so that they did not perceive it; and they were afraid to ask Him about this saying.
Who Is the Greatest?
Then*p a dispute arose among them as to which of them would be greatest.
And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a little child and set him by Him,

and said to them, “Whoever*r receives*r this*r little*r child*r in*r My*r name*r receives*r Me;*r and*r whoever*r receives*r Me*r receives*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me.*r For*r he*r who*r is*r least*r among*r you*r all*r will*r be*r great.”*r
Jesus Forbids Sectarianism
Now*p John answered and said, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in Your name, and we forbade him because he does not follow with us.”
But*p Jesus said to him, “Do*r not*r forbid*r him,*ir for*r he*r who*r is*r not*r against*r us*r is*r on*r our*r side.”*r
A Samaritan Village Rejects the Savior
Now*p it came to pass, when the time had come for Him to be received up, that He steadfastly set His face to go to Jerusalem,
and sent messengers before His face. And as they went, they entered a village of the Samaritans, to prepare for Him.
But they did not receive Him, because His face was set*i for the journey to Jerusalem.
And when His disciples James and John saw this,*i they said, “Lord, do You want us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them, just as Elijah did?”
But*p He turned and rebuked them, and said, “You*r do*r not*r know*r what*r manner*r of*r spirit*r you*r are*r of.*r
For*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r did*r not*r come*r to*r destroy*r men’s*r lives*r but*r to*r save*r them.”*ir And they went to another village.
The Cost of Discipleship
Now*p it happened as they journeyed on the road, that*i someone said to Him, “Lord, I will follow You wherever You go.”
And*p Jesus said to him, “Foxes*r have*r holes*r and*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r have*ir nests,*r but*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r nowhere*r to*r lay*r His*ir head.”*r
Then*p He said to another, “Follow*r Me.”*r But*p he said, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
Jesus*p said to him, “Let*r the*r dead*r bury*r their*r own*r dead,*r but*r you*r go*r and*r preach*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
And*p another also said, “Lord, I will follow You, but let me first go and*i bid them farewell who are at my house.”
But*p Jesus said to him, “No*r one,*r having*r put*r his*r hand*r to*r the*r plow,*r and*r looking*r back,*r is*r fit*r for*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
